title: Noisy Quantum Simulation Using Tracking, Uncomputation and Sampling
excerpt: Introduces TUSQ, a simulator that reduces overhead for noisy circuit emulation via tracking, uncomputation, and tree-based sampling.
citation: S. Dangwal, T. Oberoi, A. Sailopal, D. Shah, and F. T. Chong. (2025). "Noisy Quantum Simulation Using Tracking, Uncomputation and Sampling." arXiv, arXiv:2508.04880.

title: Circuit decompositions and scheduling for neutral atom devices with limited local addressability
venue: IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering (QCE 2024)
excerpt: Compiler pipeline and scheduling that minimize global-rotation costs for neutral atom hardware, improving circuit duration and fidelity.
citation: N. Nottingham, M. A. Perlin, D. Shah, R. White, H. Bernien, F. T. Chong, and J. M. Baker. (2024). "Circuit decompositions and scheduling for neutral atom devices with limited local addressability." IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering (QCE).

title: YFlows: Systematic Dataflow Exploration and Code Generation for Efficient Neural Network Inference using SIMD Architectures on CPUs
venue: Proceedings of the 33rd ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Compiler Construction (CC 2024)
excerpt: Explores dataflow choices and code generation to accelerate CPU inference, achieving strong speedups across NN workloads.
citation: C. Zhou, Z. Hassman, D. Shah, V. Richard, and Y. Li. (2024). "YFlows: Systematic Dataflow Exploration and Code Generation for Efficient Neural Network Inference using SIMD Architectures on CPUs." CC 2024, pp. 212–226.

title: Applicability of Clay/Organic Clay to Environmental Pollutants: Green Way—An Overview
excerpt: Overview of clay and organoclay materials for air, water, and soil pollution control with a green-chemistry perspective.
citation: Qi, J., Yu, J., Shah, K. J., Shah, D. D., & You, Z. (2023). "Applicability of Clay/Organic Clay to Environmental Pollutants: Green Way—An Overview." Applied Sciences, 13(16):9395.
